Edward Ernest Rieck (October 27, 1864 â€“ January 10, 1944) was an American entrepreneur who co-founded the Edward E. Rieck Company of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. He was a pioneer in employment of sanitation of the dairy industry via pasteurized milk.
